2.text: How long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?

3.text: These ten times have ye reproached me: ye are not ashamed [that] ye make yourselves strange to me.

4.text: And be it indeed [that] I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.

5.text: If indeed ye will magnify [yourselves] against me, and plead against me my reproach:

6.text: Know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.

7.text: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but [there is] no judgment.

8.text: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.

9.text: He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown [from] my head.

10.text: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.

11.text: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as [one of] his enemies.

12.text: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.

13.text: He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.

14.text: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.

15.text: They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.

16.text: I called my servant, and he gave [me] no answer; I intreated him with my mouth.

17.text: My breath is strange to my wife, though I intreated for the childrenâ€™s [sake] of mine own body.

18.text: Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me.

19.text: All my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me.

20.text: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.

21.text: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.

22.text: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?

23.text: Oh that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book!

24.text: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!

25.text: For I know [that] my redeemer liveth, and [that] he shall stand at the latter [day] upon the earth:

26.text: And [though] after my skin [worms] destroy this [body], yet in my flesh shall I see God:

27.text: Whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another; [though] my reins be consumed within me.

28.text: But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?

29.text: Be ye afraid of the sword: for wrath [bringeth] the punishments of the sword, that ye may know [there is] a judgment.
